snippet: Communist party officials are angered by the lifestyle of Bo Guagua, whose parents, Bo Xilai and Gu Kailai, are subjects of corruption and murder investigations.
abstract: Official statement issued by the Communist party of China blames indulgent lifestyle of Bo Guagua, whose parents Bo Xilai and Gu Kailai are subjects of corruption and murder investigations, as one of the reasons for his father's fall from power; former government employee with party ties says leadership tolerates a certain level of corruption among top officials, or their relatives, if kept out of public view.

byline.original: By ANDREW JACOBS and DAN LEVIN
byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Didi Kirsten Tatlow and Edward Wong from Beijing, John F. Burns and Ravi Somaiya from London, and Eric Newcomer from Cambridge, Mass.

lead_paragraph: Communist party officials are angered by the lifestyle of Bo Guagua, whose parents, Bo Xilai and Gu Kailai, are subjects of corruption and murder investigations.

headline.seo: Bo Guagua’s Parties and Privilege Aggravate Elite Chinese Family’s Fall
headline.main: Son’s Parties and Privilege Aggravate Fall of Elite Chinese Family
headline.print_headline: Son’s Parties and Privilege Aggravate Fall of Elite Chinese Family
